intro: Gironniera lucida, commonly known as the shining gironniera, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in wetlands and marshy areas, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine, silky hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a distinctive central disk. Gironniera lucida is often used in wetland restoration projects due to its ecological importance and adaptability to aquatic environments.
